secureKeys.title: Secure secret key
secureKeys.text:
The public key can be safely shared – it is like an account number.

The secret key is the access to your account. Treat it like a password:
• NEVER store it in cloud services, emails, or unsecured notes
• Write it down on paper or use a hardware wallet
• Create multiple backups and store them in secure, separate locations
• If the secret key is lost, access to the account is irrevocably lost

multisigSection.title: Multisig (Mehrfachsignatur)
multisigSection.text:
With multisig, you can define multiple signers for your account. Transactions then require signatures from multiple keys (z. B. 2 von 3).

Advantages:
• Increased Security (ein kompromittierter Key reicht nicht)
• Joint Accounts (z. B. Firmen, Partnerschaften)
• Emergency Recovery (mehrere Backups bei verschiedenen Personen)

CAUTION: Test multisig on the testnet first before deploying it on the mainnet! Misconfiguration can result in losing access to the account.

thresholdHelp: Threshold: The number of signatures required (master + signers) for a transaction to be valid.
thresholdLevelsHint: Typically: low = simple changes (e.g., memo, price), medium = payments/trading, high = security-critical changes (e.g., signer/thresholds).
thresholdTooHigh: Note: A threshold must not exceed the sum of the weights. Please adjust the values accordingly.

tooltips.masterWeight: Weight of the account holder (Master) (0-255): The primary key of the account holds voting rights. The higher its weight, the more votes its signature counts for. These votes are tallied together with the votes of other signatories to check if the required majority is achieved.
tooltips.signerWeight: Weight of the signers (0–255): Additional signers also have voting rights. The weight determines how many votes their signature contributes. When a transaction is sent, all cast votes are added together. If the set minimum number of votes (Threshold) is reached, the transaction is considered authorized.
tooltips.signerWeightHint: Note: Master and signatory weights add up to the sum; thresholds (niedrig/mittel/hoch) must not exceed this sum.
